name: Le Meridien Amman

reviews.title: Reasonable city hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in both the north and south towers at Le Meridien. Our rooms were ok but nothing special, with minor cleaning issues and a some noise from neighbouring rooms and outside (including morning calls to prayer). Wifi was also intermittent.
Staff were friendly and we enjoyed breakfast and our lovely steak dinner at 282 restaurant. The bed was also quite comfortable.
reviews.title: OK but nothing special

reviews.text: Overall the location was a little out of the way for us and we didn't feel that comfortable walking around. I would choose somewhere closer to the tourist areas next time.
reviews.title: Good room, large choice of restaurants

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights at beginning of our Jordan trip. Grand lobby with ok room but not 5 star for me. WiFi didn't work. Wide choice of restaurants but overpriced. We ate in the steak restaurant one night which was expensive. Location not that great. Would stay somewhere closer to old town.
reviews.title: The best of Amman

reviews.text: The hotel is well located for getting in and out of the city but is a little way off the old centre (if you want to walk).
reviews.title: Experience depends on which wing you are assigned. Ask for the South Wing.

reviews.text: arriving in Amman be careful about the taxi drivers and make sure they have the taxi meters on ;they charge whatever they like when they se you a tourist;do not get the shuttle bus from the airport is a total mess and you might get lost and finally u will need a taxi ;taxi not very expensive but do your bargain with them;the hotel look nice but the cleanliness in the rooms it can be better ;i was expecting the spa service to be better and also the dinner at the hotel was not what i was expecting;going down the city there is a street full of bars and restaurants and the food was cheaper and better ;next time i will try another hotel in the area;
reviews.title: A nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: one day we prepaid a taxi to go to petra-4 hours drive ;we agreed with the taxi driver to take us and bring us back 4 people for 200 euro ;it took us there and disappeared and we had to pay another taxi 150 euros to bring us back to Amman ; the entrance to the petra area is very expensive for tourists -pay like 20 euro each while for the locals is less than 1 euro ;iit was interesting but a terrible experience with the taxi drivers ;everything is too expensive in jordan ;
reviews.title: Not recommended...

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in August 2013. The hotel and the lobby is very impressive but room is dated and we happen to stay at the back facing the high way it was so noisy. Food was terrible drink so expensive, the service at restaurant worse than 3 stars hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but service could be better

reviews.text: Just been to Amaan for a weeks holiday. Stayed at Meridien most of the week. The staff were very friendly and the hotel had nice facilities.Used the swimming pool and also the Gym and would match any western standards.The hotel is ideally located and you can go round visiting other places no problem.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but could with some facelift

reviews.text: My only gripe was at breakfast the staff were slow at responding especially when you wanted tea or coffee. You had to keep asking whereas with other hotels I have stayed in as soon as you are seated they take your order for teas/coffees and serve you straight away.
reviews.title: Avoid!

reviews.text: We recently stayed at Le Meridien, Amman in May 2013. We wanted a comfortable hotel as a base to explore Amman and the surrounding areas. The hotel itself was nice with all the modern amenities--nothing special. The food and some services were quite expensive, but overall the hotel was nice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought the lobby area was neat and everything was clean and comfortable in the room. We really think that the staff was helpful and friendlly, which made the hotel stand out a bit more. They answered all of our questions with concern and helped us arrange multiple dinners and trips. We ended up renting a car from them, which was an okay price and convenient service.
reviews.title: Good Service. Very Decent.
Expensive services - Delicious food
reviews.text: It was a good exerpience staying at Le Meridien Amman. I would happily return again.

The hotel is nothing spectacular compared to other Meridiens around the globe but then you compare it to other hotels in the city and it is pretty decent. The service was excellent, staff was very helpful. Our bags did not land with us in Amman from Istanbul and the concierge helped us track the bags down and was very helpful. The steakhouse and the Lebanese restaurant are absolutely amazing. We stayed on the 7th floor during the Ramadan season and were not disturbed by the noise. I do not think the hotel was at the top end but definitely a very comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: A top average hotel with very expensive services such as breakfasr and internet, old furniture, very big rooms and also good restaurants (specially Al mukhtar).
reviews.title: Good Interiors.. Bad service if its busy season!

reviews.text: I stayed 9 night in Amman, the first 7 were in Grand Hayatt Amman (which was good) and the last 2 in Le Meridien and that was hell of an experience.
reviews.title: Horrible Experience

reviews.text: I don't know where shall I start from..
reviews.title: Great hotel, nice staff
Nice hotel and friendly staff
reviews.text: We checked-in, took the cards and left the hotel straight away because we were invited for dinner elsewhere. We came back and surprisingly our cards didn't work, we asked the front desk to change the cards and the big surprise is that they accommodated someone else in our room!!
We stayed in a Classic Double bedroom. Rooms are HORRIBLE. Very depressing ambiance.
reviews.title: A week in Amman

reviews.text: Bed mattress is uncomfortable and from the first night i got allergy.
reviews.title: An ok hotel

description: Le Méridien Amman is located in the centre of Amman and is a walk away from the Citadel, Roman Theatre, and many malls and shopping areas. The health club includes sauna and steam rooms, massage and facial treatments and indoor/outdoor pools. The hotel has numerous restaurants offering Japanese, Chinese, Italian, Lebanese cuisine, in addition to a steak house. World-class conference facilities include the Royal Convention Centre, which accommodates 1,200 guests and features the latest audiovisual equipment.
